hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition via Divergence Between Price and On-Chain Accumulation
hypothesis_content.statement: During BEAR regimes, when BTC price makes a lower low but the Net Unrealized Profit/Loss (NUPL) metric forms a higher low (bullish divergence), and exchange balances decline for 7+ days while price stabilizes, the regime will transition to NEUTRAL within 10 trading days with 73% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: NUPL divergence indicates selling exhaustion despite price weakness. Exchange outflow during stabilization suggests accumulation by strong hands. Reduced correlation with equities shows crypto-specific dynamics overcoming macro pressure.
entry_conditions: BTC price: lower low over past 10 days
NUPL (7-day MA): higher low vs. prior corresponding low
BTC exchange balances decline ≥ 2% over 7 days
BTC 10-day correlation with S&P 500 drops below 0.3 (decoupling)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to NEUTRAL (confidence > 55%) OR 9% price recovery from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC breaks below divergence low by >4% on closing basis

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Hypothesis fails if divergence occurs during sustained negative funding rates (< -0.01% daily) or when miner outflow metrics show increasing selling pressure from miners.
